alert.note: Alert for Prince Georges (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 14 at 7:01PM EDT until July 14 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT FOR THE SOUTHEASTERN DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA...CENTRAL PRINCE GEORGES AND THE EASTERN CITY OF ALEXANDRIA... At 701 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Forestville, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Bowie, Clinton, Forestville, Largo, Coral Hills, Upper Marlboro, Fedex Field, Andrews Air Force Base, Landover, Camp Springs, Oxon Hill, Kettering, Walker Mill, Mitchellville, Rosaryville, Lake Arbor, Marlton, Temple Hills, Marlow Heights and Seat Pleasant. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
